conclusion: Understanding the Ampere force formula: F = I L B sin(theta)
Explanation of variables in the Ampere force formula
Wire ABC consists of segments AB and BC in uniform magnetic fields
Magnetic field for AB points inward, for BC points outward
Force on AB: F_AB = I L B
Force on BC: F_BC = I L B
Direction of F_AB is upward and to the left
Direction of F_BC is downward and to the left
Angle between segments AB and BC is 120 degrees
Angle between forces F_AB and F_BC is 120 degrees
Resultant force calculation using vector addition formula
Substitute values into the vector addition formula
Final resultant force is I L B
Final answer: magnitude of the resultant Ampere force is I L B
